availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Owen Ross Baker (Caldwell County, Kentucky, farmer.)

body.p: Caldwell County, Kentucky, farmer. Kentucky native. Son of John Baker and Mary Baker. Married to Julia F. Lindsay Baker in Christian County, Kentucky, on November 17, 1853. Father of Franklin Baker, Cora Baker, Eugenia Baker, Peter R. Baker, John M. Baker, and Gertrude Baker. Attended Georgetown College in Georgetown, Kentucky, in 1848. Farmer in Caldwell County, Kentucky, in 1850. Household owned nine enslaved persons in Caldwell County in 1850. Farmer in Burnesville in 1860. Employed Alonzo Beardin as a farm laborer in Burnesville in 1860. Owned two enslaved persons in Burnesville in 1860.
